alert.note: Alert for Wyandotte (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 8:17PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wyandotte, southwestern Clay and northwestern Jackson Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 817 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kansas City Downtown, or over Kansas City Kansas, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Independence, Liberty, Gladstone, Mission, North Kansas City, Mission Hills, Sugar Creek, Riverside, Westwood, Claycomo, Kansas City Kansas, Courtney, Pleasant Valley, Glenaire, Avondale, Westwood Hills, Mission Woods, River Bend and Kansas City Downtown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 15. Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 420 and 423. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 35 in Kansas between mile markers 232 and 235. Interstate 29 between mile markers 0 and 2. Interstate 635 near mile marker 8. Interstate 435 between mile markers 52 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
